title: 14 Day Suspension, your opinions?
body:
So I just got a 14 day suspension for ONE game, no chat restriction or anything, which I find incredibly weird... I was super tilted in the game, but I never wrote anything negative about another player, just about wrote that I was bad and tilted. I gave positive feedback to my team the entire game and didn't use any words that might have been harmful to other players.
Here is the chat from that game: 
https://gyazo.com/0f1f94eea045b086c11ec3e17b57edfc 
I don't know if it's a bot or human that read the chat, because the two things I can think of that might have been offensive to another player is the first part were I wrote that he was just a ''small black baby'', but that was his actual ingame username, and the second part were I wrote kys (which I instantly corrected to kms). 
I just want to hear your opinions on this! :)
Sry for the bad pic, but I didn't want to send 9 different ones so I melted them together fast.
Edit: does anyone know how long the support takes to answer? 
Edit2: Thank you so much for your help lads! A riot employee reverted my suspensions and if it wouldn't been for your help I probably wouldn't have sent in a ticket! :) https://gyazo.com/87e72ec871e1dd893db3f3fee3259765

replies.body:
I see a bit of possible racially-charged chat with "you're just a small black baby, nothing you can do against that." But the lines that probably triggered the ZT filter for the IFS:

> i want to kys
> not kys
> kms

Honestly, you might want to put in a support ticket about this one and see what happens.

Yeah, I thought about the baby part aswell, but his ign was that haha and I wrote it after he died to an invade. :P 
Thanks for your opinion, I will send in a ticket! The thing that seems weird to me is that I've never had any chat restrictions before this...

Zero Tolerance (ZT) phrases escalate the punishment tier to a 14-day suspension, skipping the 10-game chat restriction and 25-game chat restriction tiers.

Note that if support does label the suspension an error and lift it, be sure to have them check and confirm in writing that your punishment tier is also reset to a clean record, along with Honor restoration, season rewards, and so on.

Ok, thanks for you help! Just sent in a ticket and hope for the best. :) 
Even though they might not lift it, you've helped me understand a bit more about how the system works, so big thanks!

Yeah those guys on this forum saying Riot chat bot understands context... it just fcking doesn't.

The trigger word was kys.

The system doesn’t care about context and will instantly 14 day ban if it sees it.

ARAM players were getting messed with by this too (killing yourself is actually important because you can’t shop otherwise), but if I remember right they were able to appeal the 14 day ban after the riot support got context.

Also I’m glad I always call players by the champion they’re playing, can’t get baited into saying something bannable if I ignore summoner names. You should start doing that too after this if Riot holds you too that line where you referred to the summoner by name.

I do understand that the trigger word was kys now, but writing it once and never have had a ban before this seems odd. I would understand if I wrote it like 2 or 3 times lol. Yeah, I usually call them by the champs they're playing, but I thought calling him by his IGN was quite funny in the context (He died to an invade while being semi-afk).

> [{quoted}](name=AndyBarrelRoll,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=0MlbQlQE,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-12-12T11:51:47.640+0000)

Yeah, I usually call them by the champs they're playing, but I thought calling him by his IGN was quite funny in the context (He died to an invade while being semi-afk).

It is a bit concerning that the bot is unable to differentiate between usage of the term "kys" or accidental usage as it could lead into people baiting other people into saying it without understanding the meaning or the consequences. It's not like a racial or homophobic slur which also would lead to automatic bans as well. I assume most people know what "kys" means what what if someone doesn't and simply asks what does "kys" stand for? Would they be automatically banned as well?

But anyway that appears that's what happened here. The term "kys" is a zero tolerance term that leads to an automatic ban and skips straight to a 14 day suspension. Not sure when they made it that way because I know back in S4 and S5 people used that term left and right without any consequences but now I would avoid using that term or anything remotely close to it in the future to be on the safe side.
The system does have it flaws, but I honestly rather get banned for something quite small (small IMO) than it being like CS:GO where you can write and say anything without consequenses. :P
Wait, you can use things like the n-word or tell people to "kys" without getting punished in CS:GO? Are you joshing me bro?
